page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: There are eleven farms in our area, most of them being dairy,however because of the milk surplus, some have moved out of dairy to mainly arable. Most of the bigger farms of a 1000 acres are tenanted and these generally are arable, and if the crops can be combined,only four or five men are needed to run the farm, as the use of computers helps a great deal. Manor Farm,which is in Babcary,is a pig farm and has recently moved out from dairy. Many of the orchards (which used to produce apples) in this area have now been turned into grazing land as they were not producing fruit economically. The main crops in this area are winter wheat, winter barley, oil seed rape.
